intro: Sloanea parviflora var. pedicellata, commonly known as the small-flowered sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its lanceolate, glossy leaves. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
